member.name: T:PixanKit.LaunchCore.GameModule.Game.GameBase
member.summary: Represents the base class for managing Minecraft game instances.
member.remarks:
This abstract class provides core functionality for handling Minecraft game instances, including managing game files, libraries, settings, and runtime arguments. It serves as a foundation for derived classes that implement specific game types, such as modded or vanilla versions.
Key features of this class include: - Managing paths for game resources (e.g., JAR files, libraries, and assets). - Generating launch arguments for starting the game. - Supporting runtime settings and configuration management. - Handling native library extraction and version-specific operations.
Derived classes are expected to implement additional functionality as needed, while reusing the core capabilities provided by this base class.

member.name: M:PixanKit.LaunchCore.GameModule.Game.GameBase.MyRegex
member.remarks:
Pattern:
(?<Name>\\w+)\\s*(?<Sign>=|=!)\\s*(?<Condition>[^\\s,]+)
Explanation:
○ "Name" capture group.
○ Match a word character atomically at least once.
○ Match a whitespace character atomically any number of times.
○ "Sign" capture group.
○ Match '='.
○ Match with 2 alternative expressions.
○ Match an empty string.
○ Match '!'.
○ Match a whitespace character greedily any number of times.
○ "Condition" capture group.
○ Match a character in the set [^,\s] atomically at least once.

member.name: T:PixanKit.LaunchCore.PlayerModule.MojangAPI.MojangLogin
member.summary: This class implements the Microsoft OAuth authorization code login functionality.
member.remarks:
Microsoft has changed the login verification method. You need to register an application on Azure and obtain a Client ID.
Before performing the login operation, you must provide your Client ID and Redirect URL.
Since the developer does not have the time and resources to apply for a Client ID and request application approval from Mojang, this class has not been tested. We sincerely ask developers to help with testing.
The good news is that before Mojang changes the application approval process, this class should work as expected.
